html: Covenant curse reversals for Jehovah’s righteous people include the regeneration of the land. Symbolic of the regeneration of his people, the desert blossoms overnight like the “crocus” (bassalet), the first flower of spring. Jehovah’s elect who abide there—who participate in the new exodus out of Babylon and new wandering in the wilderness—rejoice in their deliverance and sing Songs of Salvation (Isaiah 12:1-6; 25:1-5; 26:1-6; 30:29). Jehovah’s cloud of glory rests over them to protect them from enemies and from adverse elements in his Day of Judgment (Isaiah 4:5-6; 25:4-5; 58:8; 60:1-2).
